results.title: ‘The Batman’ and Matt Reeves: Emerging From the Shadow of Other Caped Crusaders
results.abstract: Amid concurrent versions of the crime-fighter, this director aimed for something personal that would also serve a studio’s needs. The result is a foreboding vision.

multimedia.caption: Matt Reeves became comfortable making large-scale studio movies after realizing “there was a way to do something personal that still had the genre aspect to it.”
multimedia.copyright: Devin Oktar Yalkin for The New York Times

results.title: SAG Awards 2022: ‘CODA,’ Will Smith and Jessica Chastain Take Top Prizes
results.abstract: “We, deaf actors, have come a long way,” the “CODA” star Marlee Matlin tells the audience. On the TV side, “Succession,” “Ted Lasso” and “Squid Game” won big.

results.title: Bappi Lahiri, India’s ‘Disco King,’ Dies at 69
results.abstract: He helped popularize the genre with some of the country’s biggest hits of all time, including “I Am a Disco Dancer.”

multimedia.caption: Bappi Lahiri in 2011 at his home in Mumbai. He grew up idolizing Elvis for his style and ultimately became known for his own flair — tinted sunglasses, shiny jackets and mounds of gold jewelry.
multimedia.copyright: Anshuman Poyrekar/Hindustan Times via Getty Images

results.title: Sally Kellerman, Oscar-Nominated ‘MASH’ Actress, Is Dead at 84
results.abstract: Ms. Kellerman, who became a star in Robert Altman’s dark satire, was known for her self-effacing comedy, a velvety voice and an ability to toggle between sultry and silly.
results.byline: By Christine Chung and Neil Genzlinger

multimedia.caption: Sally Kellerman at the 1989 Cannes Film Festival. In a memoir, she recalled wanting to be a performer from an early age: “I must have come out of the womb singing and acting.”
